entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 8.25.25
entry.summary: Judge Robert Johnson is joined by Curtis “Wall Street: Carroll who told story of being incarcerated for 27 years, and his work while in prison to learn financial literacy and now be able to share it was others. Judge Johnson also talked about the Drug Court program and its impact.

entry.title: Twisted Steel RC Hobby Shop Announces Store Closing
entry.summary: Twisted Steel RC Hobby Shop in Roseburg is closing its doors. The store confirmed it is going out of business, urging customers to use credits and warranties soon. A cash-only blowout sale with up to 50% off starts August 22, 2025. All sales final, no refunds or exchanges.

entry.title: Claire’s in Roseburg to Close on August 26
entry.summary: Claire’s in Roseburg, located at 780 NW Garden Valley Boulevard, Suite 100, will close on August 26, 2025. The closure is part of the retailer’s nationwide bankruptcy restructuring. Shoppers can expect liquidation sales until the final day, marking the end of a nostalgic local favorite.

entry.title: ROSEBURG SETS RECORD HIGH TEMPERATURE FOR THE DATE ON SATURDAY
entry.summary: August 24, 2025 5:50 a.m. Roseburg set a new record high temperature for the date on Saturday. entry.title: YMCA closed until Tuesday for upgrades, youth sport and day care registration open
entry.summary: The YMCA of Douglas County will be closed for upgrades and maintenance beginning Monday and will reopen Tuesday, Sept. 2 with a remodeled weight room and other updates, according to a press release from the facility.

entry.title: ODOT’s most persistent critic says the state could solve its road-funding crunch — by scuttling some projects
entry.summary: As the Legislature prepares for an Aug. 29 special session to bail out the Oregon Department of Transportation, Oregon economist Joe Cortright says the state agency is misleading lawmakers and the public about its budget.
